affiliation.en: Yamanouch pharmaceutical Co., LTD Central research

department.en: Graduate School, Division of Pharmaceutical Sciences

description.en: Rh-Catalyzed intermolecular hydroacylation between salicylaidehydes and 1,5-hexadienes proceeded under remarkably mild reaction conditions to afford a mixture of iso- and normal-hydroacylated products in good yields. The experiments using deuterated salicylaidehyde-d revealed that "double chelation" of salicylaldehyde and 1,5-hexadiene to Rh-complex: played vital roles in the catalytic cycle of intermolecular hydroacylation.

Rh-Catalyzed intermolecular hydroacylation between salicylaidehydes and 1,5-hexadienes proceeded under remarkably mild reaction conditions to afford a mixture of iso- and normal-hydroacylated products in good yields. The experiments using deuterated salicylaidehyde-d revealed that "double chelation" of salicylaldehyde and 1,5-hexadiene to Rh-complex: played vital roles in the catalytic cycle of intermolecular hydroacylation.

paper_title.en: Stereoselective syntheses of 2,5-disubstituted hydroxyfuran derivatives as synthon of polyether antibiotics

description.en: Stereoselective syntheses of optically active 2,5-dialkyltetrahydrofurans (8), (11) and (12), which correspond to a central moiety of pamamycin 607, have been achieved on the basis of lactone-ring transformation via a phenonium ion, intramolecular Friedel-Crafts reaction, oxidative decomposition of an aromatic ring and differentiation of two ester groups by a chemical or chemo-enzymatic method.

paper_title.en: Stereoselective syntheses of 2,5-disubstituted hydroxyfuran derivatives as synthon of polyether antibiotics

description.en: Stereoselective syntheses of optically active 2,5-dialkyltetrahydrofurans (8), (11) and (12), which correspond to a central moiety of pamamycin 607, have been achieved on the basis of lactone-ring transformation via a phenonium ion, intramolecular Friedel-Crafts reaction, oxidative decomposition of an aromatic ring and differentiation of two ester groups by a chemical or chemo-enzymatic method.

paper_title.en: Synthesis of (-)-TAN1251A using 4-hydroxy-L-proline as a chiral source

description.en: A new synthetic route of (-)-TAN1251A possessing an antimuscarinic activity was developed on the basis of alkylation of a trans-4-hydroxy-L-proline derivative and the subsequent construction of an azaspiro ring as key steps. (C) 2002 Published by Elsevier Science Ltd.

paper_title.en: Synthesis of (-)-TAN1251A using 4-hydroxy-L-proline as a chiral source

description.en: A new synthetic route of (-)-TAN1251A possessing an antimuscarinic activity was developed on the basis of alkylation of a trans-4-hydroxy-L-proline derivative and the subsequent construction of an azaspiro ring as key steps. (C) 2002 Published by Elsevier Science Ltd.

paper_title.en: Intramolecular reaction of a phenonium ion. Novel lactonization of 4-aryl-5-tosyloxypentanoates and 4-aryl-5-tosyloxyhexanoates concomitant with a phenyl rearrangement

description.en: The novel lactonizations of methyl 4-aryl-5-tosyloxypentanoate 1 and 4-aryl-5-tosyloxyhexanoate 3 concomitant with a phenyl rearrangement are reported. The lactonizations were promoted by silica gel or heating in various solvents. By examining the effects of substituents of the aromatic ring on the reactivity, it was found that the reaction proceeded via a phenonium ion. This finding was supported by the stereochemical results for the lactonization of optical active 1. Silica gel-promoted lactonization of I gave only gamma-lactone 2, whereas that of 3 afforded gamma-lactone 4 and delta-lactone 5. These lactonizations proved to be kinetically controlled. On the other hand, when 3c was heated in CH3NO2 at 70 degreesC, the highly selective formation of 4c was observed. Further detailed experiments confirmed that the thermal lactonization in CH3NO2 was thermodynamically controlled.

paper_title.en: Intramolecular reaction of a phenonium ion. Novel lactonization of 4-aryl-5-tosyloxypentanoates and 4-aryl-5-tosyloxyhexanoates concomitant with a phenyl rearrangement

description.en: The novel lactonizations of methyl 4-aryl-5-tosyloxypentanoate 1 and 4-aryl-5-tosyloxyhexanoate 3 concomitant with a phenyl rearrangement are reported. The lactonizations were promoted by silica gel or heating in various solvents. By examining the effects of substituents of the aromatic ring on the reactivity, it was found that the reaction proceeded via a phenonium ion. This finding was supported by the stereochemical results for the lactonization of optical active 1. Silica gel-promoted lactonization of I gave only gamma-lactone 2, whereas that of 3 afforded gamma-lactone 4 and delta-lactone 5. These lactonizations proved to be kinetically controlled. On the other hand, when 3c was heated in CH3NO2 at 70 degreesC, the highly selective formation of 4c was observed. Further detailed experiments confirmed that the thermal lactonization in CH3NO2 was thermodynamically controlled.

paper_title.en: Novel ether-ring transformation via a phenonium ion

description.en: Upon treatment with CF3COOH at 70degreesC, trisubstituted-tetrahydropyrans. which were stereoselectively prepared from delta-lactones, were found to be converted into the corresponding 2,5-disubstituted-tetrahydrofurans stereospecifically via a phenonium ion. Furthermore, the stereocontrolled formal synthesis of paramycin 607 was achieved based on the ether-ring transformation. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Novel ether-ring transformation via a phenonium ion

description.en: Upon treatment with CF3COOH at 70degreesC, trisubstituted-tetrahydropyrans. which were stereoselectively prepared from delta-lactones, were found to be converted into the corresponding 2,5-disubstituted-tetrahydrofurans stereospecifically via a phenonium ion. paper_title.en: 7-endo selective Friedel-Crafts type cyclization of vinyloxiranes linked to an ester group

description.en: Treatment of arylpropyl vinyloxiranes linked to ester with BF3 was found to produce seven-membered ring products in excellent yields. This reaction proceeded in an inversion fashion. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Novel skeletal rearrangement of hydroindan derivatives into hydroazulenones via an alkoxy radical

description.en: A novel construction of hydroazulenones using skeletal rearrangement of epoxy-hydroindan derivatives via alkoxy radical was developed. The reaction was also found to proceed without damage of acetal or olefin group. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Novel skeletal rearrangement of hydroindan derivatives into hydroazulenones via an alkoxy radical

description.en: A novel construction of hydroazulenones using skeletal rearrangement of epoxy-hydroindan derivatives via alkoxy radical was developed. The reaction was also found to proceed without damage of acetal or olefin group. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Total Synthesis of antimoscarine alkaloid,(±)- TAN1251A
7-endo Selective Friedel-Crafts type Cyclization of Vinyloxiranes linked to an ester groop
The novel skeletal rearrangement of cyclopentanones into hydroazulenones via a radical process and its application to the formal synthesis of damsinic acid

description.en: A new skeletal rearrangement of cyclopentanones with pentynyl side chains into hydroazulene compounds via a radical process was developed. The presence of a triethylsilyloxy group at the alpha -position of the cyclopentanone was found to increase the reactivity. Except for this, there was no limitation of the reaction. The reaction was also applied to synthetic studies of damsinic acid, which was isolated from Ambrosia ambrosioides (Cav.) Payne along with damsin. (C) 2000 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Skeletal rearrangement via alkoxy radical: Conversion of epoxydecalin thiocarbonylimidazolides to bicyclo[6.3.0]undecanones and bicyclo[5.3.1]undecanones

description.en: The skeletal rearrangement of five types of epoxydecalin thiocarbonylimidazolides was investigated. This reaction proceeded via a 10-membered cyclic carbon radical formed by P-cleavage of alkoxy radicals, and produced two types of skeletal rearranged products; i.e. bicyclo[6.3.0]undecanones and bicyclo[5.3.1]undecanones. The ratio of the products strongly depended on the character and stereochemistry of the substituents. (C) 2000 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Application of liquid chromatography-atmospheric pressure chemical ionization mass spectrometry to the differentiation of stereoisomeric C-19-norditerpenoid alkaloids

description.en: High-performance liquid chromatography-atmospheric pressure chemical ionization mass spectrometry (HPLC-APCI-MS) was successfully applied to stereoisomeric C-19-norditerpenoid alkaloids at position 1. APCI-MS allowed the easy and precise control of the energy deposition by varying the drift voltage. Comparison of the breakdown curves, observed by changing the potential difference between the first electrode and the second electrode of the APCI ion source, revealed stereochemical dependence of different fragmentations, The APCI spectra of alkaloids were predominantly the [M + H](+) ion and major fragment ion, corresponding to the [M + H - H2O](+) ion or the [M + H - CH3COOH](+) ion, and comparison of the spectra showed that the abundance of fragment ions was significantly higher for C-1 beta-form alkaloids than for C-1 alpha-form alkaloids. The characteristic fragment ions were formed by the loss of a water, acetic acid or methanol molecule at position 8, The fragmentation mechanisms depending on the stereochemistry of the precursor ion could be discerned by recording the spectra in a deuterated solvent system of 0.05 M ammonium acetate in D2O-acetonitrile-tetrahydrofuran. Loss of D2O from the precursor ion gave the fragment ion. This result indicated that the proton of protonation was included in the leaving water molecule. The peak intensity ratio R = [M + H](+) / [M + H - H2O](+) manifested the stereochemical differentiation of alkaloids at position 1.

paper_title.en: Application of Liquid Chromatography-Atmospheric Pressure Chemical Ionization Mass Spetrometry to the Differentiation of Stereoisomeric Diterpenoid Alkaloids
